channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: White House looking for someone to blame, and CDC chief might be it, sources say
CNN anchor wants you to hear this quote from Trump
item.description: CNN's Chris Cuomo argues that President Trump doesn't like coronavirus testing, tracing or masks because they may make people "less pumped to reopen recklessly."

item.title: At least 12 people have died in India after Cyclone Amphan makes landfall
India and Bangladesh's cyclone evacuations complicated by coronavirus
item.description: Cyclone evacuation efforts in India and Bangladesh are being complicated by the coronavirus pandemic, as relief teams grapple with how to get millions of people to safety while also protecting them against the risk of Covid-19.

item.title: Trump will lose in 'historic' landslide because of US economy, election model predicts
President Trump fires back at Fox News host
item.description: After President Trump announced he was taking antimalarial drug hydroxychloroquine, Fox News host Neil Cavuto had a starkly different message than his colleagues.

item.title: They bought a $1 house in Italy, then Covid-19 struck
item.description: When Italian towns began offering houses for sale for little more than $1, they inspired legions of dreamers to take a gamble on moving to a remote corner of Italy.

item.title: New York subway launches UV light program in effort to kill Covid-19
item.description: The agency in charge of public transit in New York City announced a pilot program using ultraviolet light lamps to kill Covid-19 on buses and trains and at stations.

item.title: Brazil records its worst daily death toll from coronavirus
item.description: Brazil has recorded its highest daily number of coronavirus deaths and cases, one day after it became the country with the third-highest number of confirmed cases in the world.

item.title: Pandemic could force 60 million more people to live on less than $2 a day, World Bank says
item.description: The coronavirus pandemic could push as many as 60 million people into extreme poverty, the World Bank said on Tuesday.

item.title: India reports biggest one-day jump in cases
Ex-US special forces soldier and son arrested for alleged roles in Ghosn smuggling plot
item.description: Two Massachusetts men accused of helping to smuggle former Nissan chief executive Carlos Ghosn out of Japan late last year were arrested Wednesday morning in the US, according to court documents.

item.title: Body of 39-year-old former WWE star found on California beach
item.description: The body of former WWE star Shad Gaspard was found on a California beach early Wednesday morning, three days after he went missing during a swim.

item.title: A boy chosen as the Panchen Lama disappeared in 1995. China says he's now a college grad with a job
item.description: Twenty-five years ago, a six-year-old boy was recognized as the reincarnation of the Panchen Lama, the second-highest ranking figure in Tibetan Buddhism. He promptly disappeared.

item.title: The foolish mistake that put an end to my travels
item.description: Every time I read a news story about a young traveler in hospital in Thailand struggling to get home following a horrible motorbike accident, my stomach twists into a knot.

item.title: How sharing dinner table items can make you sick
item.description: CNN's Randi Kaye takes a closer look at how quickly germs can spread in restaurants through a science experiment designed to track germ droplets.

item.title: Trump likely to decide in coming days whether to host G7 in person
item.description: President Donald Trump will likely decide within the next few days whether to host the G7 in person after he publicly raised the idea Wednesday on Twitter, according to a White House official.

item.title: Barr met with prosecutor now reviewing Russia probe immediately after Mueller investigation ended
item.description: Almost immediately after special counsel Robert Mueller closed his investigation last year, Attorney General William Barr was huddling with the prosecutor he assigned to re-examine the Russia probe -- in a series of meetings that haven't been previously known and appear to highlight Barr's drive to rewrite the legacy of the Mueller investigation.

item.title: Another Disney heir slams the company's business practices
item.description: Another heir of Walt Disney is publicly expressing disgust with the company his grandfather founded for furloughing thousands of workers while continuing to pay its executives millions of dollars and massive bonuses.

item.title: These before and after images show how much a Michigan dam failure drained a lake
item.description: Videos and images captured by witnesses show just how much water was unleashed when Michigan's Edenville Dam failed.

item.title: Tiffany Trump graduates from law school
item.description: President Donald Trump on Wednesday tweeted his congratulations to Tiffany Trump, the fourth of his five children, in support of her graduation from law school. Tiffany Trump took part in virtual commencement ceremonies, along with the rest of the class of 2020, from Georgetown Law School on Saturday.

item.title: Matt Lauer responds to rape allegation from Ronan Farrow's 'Catch & Kill'
item.description: Matt Lauer had been looking for an opportune time to publish a piece responding to Ronan Farrow's "Catch & Kill," which contained a rape allegation that he denied. In the wake of Ben Smith's New York Times column scrutinizing Farrow's work, he went ahead.

item.title: State police search home of suspects in Ahmaud Arbery's killing
item.description: The Georgia Bureau of Investigation searched the home of two men charged in the death of Ahmaud Arbery, the agency said.

item.title: Ford forced to halt production at Chicago plant after employee tests positive for Covid-19
item.description: One day after reopening a Chicago assembly plant, Ford temporarily shut down the factory because two employees tested positive for Covid-19.

item.title: Female Fortune 500 CEOs reach an all-time high, but it's still a small percentage
item.description: The number of women running Fortune 500 companies has hit an all-time record of 37.

item.title: New details emerge on Reade's exit from Biden's office
item.description: New details emerge from a former coworker about why Tara Reade may have left Joe Biden's Senate office in 1993. CNN's MJ Lee reports conflicting accounts further complicate Reade's allegation against the former Vice President.

item.title: Rolls-Royce is cutting at least 9,000 jobs as the coronavirus slams aviation
item.description: Aircraft engine maker Rolls-Royce is cutting at least 9,000 jobs because of the collapse in demand for air travel caused by the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Pregnant women in Madagascar get free transport to hospitals during coronavirus pandemic
item.description: Raholimalala Avotiana is rocking her newborn baby boy to sleep. It's her fourth day at the Maternity Hospital of Befelatanana in Antananarivo, Madagascar's capital.

item.title: A mink may have infected a human with Covid-19, Dutch authorities believe
item.description: Dutch authorities believe a mink may have infected a human with Covid-19, and are instituting mandatory testing at all mink farms in the Netherlands.

item.title: Russian coronavirus cases rise as Putin's popularity plunges
item.description: As confirmed coronavirus cases in Russia continue to increase, President Vladimir Putin's approval rating has plunged to an all-time low. CNN's Matthew Chance reports.

item.title: Oil prices are recovering. Is it too much, too fast?
item.description: What a difference a month makes. Oil prices after dropping to historic lows in April have moved away from the cliff edge, pushing higher as demand for energy picks up, more producers keep crude in the ground and concerns about insufficient storage ease.

item.title: This company made aircraft parts. Now it's making N95 masks
item.description: In the UAE, Mubadala Aerospace is shifting its operations from airplane parts to surgical masks. They expect nearly a billion orders for N95 masks over the next five years. CNN's John Defterios reports.

item.title: This Tokyo pub has a machine that sprays customers with disinfectant as they enter
item.description: As businesses around the world adopt new practices due to coronavirus, one Japanese pub is taking a novel approach to customer safety.

item.title: How Asia's richest man is trying to build the next global tech giant
item.description: Mukesh Ambani wants to build the next global technology company. And if he plays his cards right, his mobile carrier and technology juggernaut JioPlatforms could soon hold rank alongside the likes of Google, Amazon, Alibaba and Tencent.

item.title: Pizza maker delivers response to Michael Jordan's 'Flu Game'
item.description: Among Michael Jordan's seemingly infinite list of great moments, "The Flu Game" in the 1997 NBA Finals against the Utah Jazz is close to the top.

item.title: From footballer to Netflix superstar: How Jesus Mosquera became one of Spain's top actors
item.description: Hugo Beltran has been on screen for less than two minutes but already he's down to only some skimpy underwear, his chiseled abs rippling as he gyrates on stage for scores of delighted women.

item.title: Nicole Kidman broke her ankle 'running around the neighborhood,' according to Keith Urban
item.description: According to Keith Urban there has not been much dancing with wife, Nicole Kidman, around their house recently.

item.title: Houston church cancels mass following death of priest
item.description: A church in Houston has canceled mass indefinitely after one of its priests died and five others tested positive for the coronavirus.

item.title: 'The Batman' actor Charlie Carver talks feeling 'unsafe' at school for being gay
item.description: Charlie Carver, who appears in the upcoming "The Batman" film, revealed in a speech that he felt unsafe in school growing up because he is gay and many kids weren't so understanding.

item.title: Astronomers spot 'twist' evidence of a baby planet in a young star system
item.description: A spiral marks the spot where a baby planet is forming around a star in a young system 520 light-years from Earth in the Auriga constellation. The planet birth is visible in new images and observations made by astronomers using the European Southern Observatory's Very Large Telescope in Chile.

item.title: Runner completes 19 marathons in 19 days for coronavirus relief
item.description: A runner from the Isle of Man has gone the distance -- and beyond -- to raise money for coronavirus relief.

item.title: Drew Barrymore calls herself 'hot mess' during pandemic
item.description: CNN's Chloe Melas talks to actress Drew Barrymore about life at home with children during the coronavirus pandemic and the taco Tuesday event she's hosting online to raise money for kids in need.

item.title: The US President will say something else outlandish, false or ridiculous soon, as the list of things he wants everyone to ignore grows
item.description: Here's a bold prediction: President Donald Trump is going to say something either totally outlandish, verifiably false or completely ridiculous soon.

item.title: White House looking for someone to blame, and CDC chief might be it, sources say
item.description: A day after President Donald Trump privately excoriated the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention to Republican senators during a lunch on Capitol Hill, the fate of the agency's director, Dr. Robert Redfield, is in question.

item.title: CDC officials: White House decisions worsening pandemic effects
India reports biggest one-day jump in cases
All states partially reopen
At least 12 people have died during Cyclone Amphan
item.description: Cyclone tracks for Kolkata In pictures: Cyclone bears down on millions

item.title: Trump will lose in a landslide because of the economy, new election model predicts
item.description: Analysis: Trump has a real shot of winning

item.title: Trump offers snapshot of conspiracy mindset
item.description: Murder. Fraud. Miscarriage of justice.
